title: Wheeking
text: A loud, high-pitched squeal used to signal excitement or a desire for attention. It’s most often heard when a guinea pig anticipates food or social interaction. This is one of their most vocal and communicative sounds.

title: Chutting
text: A series of soft, repetitive clicking or popping sounds made when a guinea pig is calmly exploring. It indicates comfort and curiosity in a relaxed environment.

title: Purring
text: A low, vibrating sound with multiple meanings depending on tone. A long, relaxed purr suggests calm or enjoyment, while a short, tense purr may indicate annoyance or mild stress.

title: Teeth Chattering
text: A rapid clicking made by grinding the teeth, used as a clear warning to back off. It’s a sign of agitation or potential aggression, usually during social tension.

title: Chirping
text: A rare, bird-like series of high-pitched notes. Its cause isn’t fully understood, but it may occur in times of stress, confusion, or heightened alertness.

title: Whining
text: A high-pitched, drawn-out whimper used to express discomfort or irritation. It often occurs when a guinea pig is unhappy with being touched or disturbed.

title: Cooing
text: A soft, soothing murmur often used between bonded guinea pigs, especially from mothers to young. It reflects comfort and emotional bonding.

title: Squeaking
text: A quick, high-pitched cry indicating mild distress, fear, or objection. It’s often a reaction to unwanted handling or dominance behavior from another guinea pig.

title: Rumbling
text: A deep, vibrating sound used mainly during mating behavior or to establish dominance. Often accompanied by body language such as slow movements or posturing.
